description: A massive island ship commanded by Gecko Moria, one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea. It serves as the setting for the ongoing battle between the Straw Hats and Moria's zombie army.

keyEvents.title: Oars Trapped and Battle Continues
keyEvents.description: Oars remains stuck with his horns embedded in the ground before freeing himself and continuing the battle against the Straw Hats.
keyEvents.significance: The ongoing battle location where the Straw Hats employ creative tactics against the giant zombie.

keyEvents.title: Kuma Appears at Thriller Bark
keyEvents.description: Bartholomew Kuma makes his dramatic arrival at Thriller Bark, appearing at the Thousand Sunny.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces a new major threat to the island, escalating the danger level significantly.

statusHistory.reason: Thriller Bark remains operational during this episode

name.japanese: サウザンド・サニー号

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' ship, designed and built by Franky. During this episode, it becomes the location where Nami confronts Bartholomew Kuma after Perona attempts to steal treasure.

keyEvents.title: Kuma Appears at the Thousand Sunny
keyEvents.description: Bartholomew Kuma appears at the Thousand Sunny, where Perona had been planning to escape with the stolen treasure.
keyEvents.significance: The ship becomes the location of a critical encounter between Kuma and the Straw Hats.

keyEvents.title: Kuma Defeats Perona at the Sunny
keyEvents.description: At the Thousand Sunny, Kuma uses his Nikyu Nikyu no Mi powers to instantly vanish Perona.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the vulnerability of the Straw Hats' ship to elite-level threats.

keyEvents.title: Kuma Questions Nami at the Sunny
keyEvents.description: At the Thousand Sunny, Kuma questions Nami about Luffy's brother before mysteriously departing.
keyEvents.significance: The ship serves as the location where crucial information about Ace is discussed.

statusHistory.reason: The Thousand Sunny remains the Straw Hats' vessel
